dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking incredibly weary, NICK WATERS, 30's, enters his apartment in his business suit. He stumbles into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

He pops one in the microwave, then glances over at a framed photo of a slightly younger Nick kissing a smiling OLD WOMAN on the cheek. The frame reads: "I Y Grandma!" Nick sighs sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick showers while simultaneously brushing his teeth and shaving. He loses track and brushes his face with the toothbrush. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he drives to work, he dials a number and transfers it to speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. This is like the only time I have to make any personal calls. I just wanted to see if you felt like going out again because I had a great time with you on our last date.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Our last date was two weeks ago. You haven't called me since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know and that's my bad. I've been swamped at work --

dialogues.speaker: JENNA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I remember. Work was all you talked about when we went out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Well, I'm up for a promotion which will give me a lot more free time --

dialogues.speaker: JENNA, (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soulless four-story building in a drab office park. Nick exits his car and runs full-speed to the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick bursts through the doors and looks at his watch. It reads "6:02." He looks up at a security camera with a flashing red light, indicating he is on tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: HARKEN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

So, I'm going to be knocking down the wall between my office and what would've been the Senior VP's to create a single, enormous office. However, as a cost-cutting measure, I will only be taking 85% of the additional salary I'm entitled to. It's called self- sacrifice, people. Learn from this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: This is rape! You raped me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get all dramatic. Your dick wasn't hard. But it will be next time. Or else Stacy here gets a look at my photo album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up the packet of photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's repair this patient's filling, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale gapes at her, dumbstruck. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and Nick are playing a videogame as Dale bursts through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's kill the bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boss. Our bosses. They need to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kurt exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were drunk last night, man. And didn't you say killing was wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was before Julia tried to fuck me on top of my fiance's unconscious body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we kill them all. Are you guys in or out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn to Nick who is uncertain. Kurt spots the photo of Nick with his GRANDMOTHER and grabs it off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her. Look at Bubby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gam Gam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at Gam Gam. Getting a smooch from her favorite grandson. Little does she know that she'll never get to say goodbye to him. And why? Because his shithead boss wouldn't let him leave. What would Gam Gam want you to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about Gam Gam. This is about you. What do you want, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! Let's do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking about that on my way over. Stacy and I watch a lot of `Law & Order' and there's a ton of ways criminals mess up. Things we'd never think of. They leave behind clothing fibers, bullet casings, hair, skin cells --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skin cells?! I can't even keep track of my keys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. And that's why we need a professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, a hitman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that's not bad. I mean, we don't clean our own apartments, right? We hire someone to clean them for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you do, moneybags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But where are we supposed to find a hitman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the only problem. I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a beat. Kurt's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Meet at my place tomorrow after work. And make sure you're not followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would anyone follow us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. People get followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just meet me at my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt opens the door on Nick and Dale. The decor of Kurt's place is best described as a middle-income bachelor pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. The guy should be here pretty soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. You actually found someone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was as easy as buying a used futon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to his computer. On the screen is a listing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craigslist?! You found a hitman on Craigslist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. But they don't post it as `hitman.' That would be stupid. They use code words, like `liquidation,' `pest control,' `wet work.' Check it out. This is our guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick reads the listing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Skilled professional with years of experience in domestic and international wet work. Fast and discreet. No children or political figures.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? He's principled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so dangerous. What if he's a narc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Kurt. Call him back and cancel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late. He's on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do if this guy gets here and he asks for so much money that we can't afford him and he gets mad and kills all of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he'd stay in business long if he killed everyone who couldn't afford him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out window) Guys! I think this is him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others hurry to look. From -- 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a black Mercedes SLK pull up. A distinguished- looking MAN in a well-tailored suit steps out. He wears sunglasses and carries a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. This guy's legit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet that briefcase has one of those guns you have to screw together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's just be professional here. We don't want to seem all giddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt opens the door on the Man who looks even smoother up close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is one of you Kurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Nick) Oh my God, he's like James Bond!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Man) Yes, hi, I'm Kurt. Please come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Are all three of you participating in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. Now before we go any further, I need to know if there are any hidden recording devices in this room. I will find out if there are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no! We definitely don't want to record this, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the middle of the living room, opens his briefcase and takes out a plastic tarp which he proceeds to unfurl over the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa. What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want you to kill us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill you? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys exchange a confused look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ad said you do wet work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct. I urinate on other men for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think my ad was in the `men seeking men' section?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were looking in `men seeking men'?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! We're men seeking a man, aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are such a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're telling me I drove all the way to the Valley and no one wants to be pissed on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't kill people! (then, sighing) Can I use your rest room? I've stored up rather a large amount of pee for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right through there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man heads off. After a beat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing I didn't call the guy who was offering to do `dirty work.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt drives. Nick is in the passenger seat. Dale in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll take the blame for that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's big of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make it up to you. I figured out a much better way to find a contract killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt reaches up and pushes a button on the rear-view mirror. A male voice comes over the speaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Gamble, thank you for contacting On Star --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your plan?

dialogues.speaker: ON STAR REP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- my name is Gregory. How can I be of service this evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregory, I need you to direct me to the most dangerous bar in Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAR REP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find the bar with the most scumbags, lowlifes and hardcore shitheads. Can you help us out?

dialogues.speaker: ON STAR REP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm afraid our listings are not organized by danger, sir. I do see there is a Bennigan's three blocks from your current

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Gregory? That's unhelpful. While I'm sure there are plenty of shitheads there, they're not the kind of shitheads we need.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAR REP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I can direct you to the neighborhood with the greatest number of car-jackings in your area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're talking.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAR REP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Very good, sir. You may wish to lock your doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and the others lock their doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt's car drives down a depressed-looking block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are still chatting with Gregory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you like living in Bangalore?

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY, (ON STAR REP)
dialogues.text: It's not bad. Humid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, `Gregory.' Is that your real name?

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No, sir. My real name is Atmanand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atmanand? How did you get Gregory from that?

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: `Gregory' was assigned to me by On Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't they let you use your real name?

dialogues.speaker: GREGORY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Many Americans find our real names off-putting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I do find Atmanand a little off-putting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have arrived at your destination, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Gregory./Thanks, Gregory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt's car pulls up on a grimy-looking South-Central street and stops in front of a dingy bar. The guys get out and look around warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you worried about your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, Gregory's watching it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think we're gonna find a hitman in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're gonna have a hard time deciding between all the hitmen in there. Trust me, these are the lowest of the low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three guys enter the squalid, smoky place. The room is full of surly-looking PATRONS, none of them white. People turn to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, real nice, Kurt. Way to be racist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a race thing. We need a criminal and this neighborhood is where they live. I'm not saying that's because there are a lot of black people here. That's the fault of our society that discriminates and disenfranchises them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said they were the lowest of the low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was speaking socio-economically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do now? Yell out `anyone here kill people for money?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They each take a seat at the bar where a no-nonsense BARTENDER walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. How you doing? Nice place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, does anyone here kill people for money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An intense-looking GUY on the next stool notices them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fuck did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong. This isn't about race. Our society discriminates and disenfranchises

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (head in hands) Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a small business owner. Who are you calling disenfranchised?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean you in particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. You mean all black people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could do that. Or I could take the aluminum baseball bat I'm holding in my right hand and disenfranchise your teeth from your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I vote we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three stand and head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're going. I'm sorry if I offended you. It was never my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, please shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey doke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys come out onto the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. We're never gonna find someone to do this for us.

dialogues.speaker: COCKSUCKER JONES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to see COCKSUCKER JONES, 30s, the guy who was sitting next to them at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can help you boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures for them to follow him into the alley beside the bar. Kurt and Nick move to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we're just gonna follow him into that alley?... All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker Jones leans in to the three guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you're looking for someone to take care of some business for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we are. Are you a... businessman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting out his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure whether to take his hand) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your first name is Cocksucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my last name's Jones. You got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. It's just interesting. That's the name on your birth certificate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, man. It's a nickname. My real name is Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Like Dean Jones. The actor from Herbie the Love Bug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Dale) I don't think he knows who Dean Jones is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who Dean Jones is, bitch! I can't walk around here with that kind of faggy, cracker name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you chose `cocksucker'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Nobody fucks with a cocksucker. `Cocksucker' is the toughest name there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not `motherfucker'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I considered Motherfucker. But in the end, I thought Cocksucker Jones sounded more badass than Motherfucker Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's the thing: we each work for a boss that we need to get rid of. Is that something you might be able to help us with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. Assuming you've got the cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got cheese. How much cheese are we talking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For three hits? That's gonna run you thirty large.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot of cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have that much cheese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there any kind of discount because we're buying three at once? Like buy two, get one free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't the motherfucking Cold Stone Creamery. It's thirty large or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way we can pay that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five large.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good negotiating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot more reasonable. And that would be for all three, Cocksucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. We're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, meet me back here tomorrow night with the cash. I'll take care of the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we bring the bills in any kind of special denominations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just, whatever. Small bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you want it in any particular container, like a shoebox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a paper bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or plastic. I read an article that plastic is actually better for the environment than paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the environment! Just put that shit in a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. Thanks. Come on, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn to go, when Dale turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we deduct the cost of the briefcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, assuming we don't get the case back... We're not getting the case back, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's like an extra eighty bucks. Only seems fair that we should take that out of your end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll cover the briefcase, Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's get a cheap one. It doesn't have to be real leather. (then to Cocksucker) Are you cool with faux -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt grabs Dale by the shoulder and hustles him to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: Frank Sinatra's "(Forget Your Troubles, Come On) Get Happy"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Dale, Kurt and Nick each take a turn at an ATM machine, withdrawing the maximum amount they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Nick at his desk at work. He looks over his cubicle wall and his eyes narrow as he sees Harken directing a WORKMAN who stencils the words "Senior Vice President of Sales" below where it already says "President." Another WORKMAN uses a sledgehammer on the wall of the office. Nick grins malevolently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Kurt is at his desk in the chemical company. He looks up to see Bobby Pellit open his office door and lead out two obvious HOOKERS. Pellit has white powder around his nostrils. He spots Kurt watching him and he sneers back. Kurt smiles devilishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CLOSE ON Dale as he places tooth X-rays into plastic contact sheets. PULL BACK to reveal Julia is licking his neck while tweaking his nipples through his scrubs. In contrast to earlier, Dale appears to be unfazed and almost amused by Julia's antics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker Jones holds an open briefcase that's empty but for a single stack of taped together 20-dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it's all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out we didn't really need the briefcase after all. Could've just used a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Cocksucker, how long do you think it'll be before you've... taken care of business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the thing. I just got out of doing a dime for some pretty ugly shit and I'm still on probation. They're watching me. So if I step out of line, I go right back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told us you could take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm gonna. I'm gonna be your professional advisor. Think of me as your murder consultant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want a murder consultant. We want a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew we were getting ripped off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, look. This isn't what we talked about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we just get our money back, please? Then we'll be on our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, no refunds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's five thousand dollars. You think we're just gonna walk away and let you keep that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting in his face) I think you're forgetting who you're talking to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker pulls back the lower edge of his jacket to reveal what appears to be the holster of a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! We don't want any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now either I give you the advice you paid for, or you can walk away with nothing. Up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the whole reason we came to you is because we don't have the experience to do it ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most killers are first-timers. Look, the key to a good murder is making it look like an accident. Gas leak, brakes failing, suicide, that sort of thing. If you do it right, you won't even have to be there when it goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes sense. But how would we fake three accidents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to stalk your prey, track their movements, get to know them inside and out. Where do they go? What do they eat for breakfast? Who're they fucking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about surveillance and recon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But making it look like an accident won't be enough if the pigs can pin a motive on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we all have obvious motives for killing our bosses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why don't you kill each other's bosses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's a good idea. Like Hitchcock's Strangers on a Train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Danny DeVito movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the famous Alfred Hitchcock/Danny DeVito movie. You're thinking of Throw Mama from the Train. But it's actually the same idea. If we kill each other's bosses there's no link to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you're paying me for. Now ain't that worth five grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all AD LIB "no's."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, too fucking bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is poring over a stack of documents when his phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and Dale wait in the car outside of Nick's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're outside. You ready for a little recon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just need to get Harken to let me leave early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference? He's not going to be your boss much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I get fired before we kill Harken, this'll all have been for nothing. I'll just be an out-of- work murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be down in three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up then peers over his cubicle wall to see Harken talking to another EMPLOYEE nearby. Nick takes a breath, leans over his garbage pail and sticks a Commtronix pen down his throat. At the sound of Nick's loud WRETCHING, Harken looks over to see him puking into the trash pail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in God's name...?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. I've been fighting this bug all day. I'll just get back to work --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick wipes his mouth and turns pathetically back to his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Go home. I don't want you getting everyone else sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. Thank you, Mr. Harken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick grabs his jacket and moves to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Take your work with you. Have it on my desk at six AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick barely conceals his contempt as he picks up the stack of papers and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt's car pulls up slowly and parks. Kurt, Dale and Nick slump down in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, as soon as Pellit makes a move, we tail him. It is on now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hells yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the house with steely determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are bored out of their minds, barely awake. Dale nibbles on a peanut butter and jelly sandwich in a plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugghhhhh, I can't believe how much this sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. On TV, surveillance always looks so great. They've got their cups of coffee. Their sunflower seeds. They talk about their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, right when they reveal something really intimate, the perp appears and they spring into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, silent pause as they watch the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we even sure he's home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening his door) Let's go check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out of the car. Dale pockets his sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three guys creep around Pellit's patio, peeking in doors and windows. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt is about to try a window when Dale stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not gonna get intel standing on his lawn. We have to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about fingerprints? We don't have gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt pulls his shirt sleeves down over his hands. Dale does the same. Nick, who wears a T-shirt, tucks his hands inside the bottom of the shirt. With some difficulty, Kurt slides open the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them manage to wriggle through the window. It's not graceful: Dale's foot gets caught on the sill, causing him to tumble on top of Nick and Kurt. At last, all three are inside. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, keep an eye out. Let us know if Pellit's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. Wait, I don't know what he looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. Just tell us if anyone comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take in Pellit's living room. There's a leather sofa, a 60-inch plasma and enormous speakers. On the wall are framed Ed Hardy posters depicting dragons and half-naked girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. This guy's a bigger douchebag than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's split up. Look for any intel we can use on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of intel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess we'll know it when we see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt heads upstairs while Dale and Nick look around the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Nick? Does this count as intel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks over to see Dale holding in his sleeve-covered hands an open wooden box filled with white powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, that's a lot of blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, this must be worth, like, ten thousand -- oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the box slips out of Dale's hands. It hits the floor, sending a cascade of cocaine all over the rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, my sleeves were slippery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get that back in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kneels and begins trying to scoop up the coke in his hands. It's an impossible task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt looks around the room. He doesn't see anything useful so he heads into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips on the light. His eyes land on Pellit's toothbrush. He grins slyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is still on his knees, scooping up coke, as Nick returns from the kitchen cradling a Dustbuster in his T- shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out. Let me try this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling with his hands in his T-shirt, Nick vacuums up the cocaine from the rug. When he's finished, he pops open the vacuum's waste receptacle and dumps the contents back in the wooden box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is now filled not only with cocaine, but bits of hair, dust bunnies, food and other crap. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we should've emptied the Dustbuster before we used it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just BELOW FRAME, Kurt removes Pellit's toothbrush from his ass and returns it to its holder, careful to keep his hands covered with his sleeves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's about to go when he notices a bar of Neutrogena face soap beside the sink. He looks around deviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale and Nick are doing their best to pick the crap out of Pellit's cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look, there's a piece of cereal in here. Can't tell if that's a corn flake or a frosted flake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt comes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, my work upstairs is done. You guys ready to split?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt pulls away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to be better prepared. That was totally dangerous and a complete waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a complete waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a BlackBerry out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... don't tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole that from Pellit's house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got his calendar and his contacts. This is what recon's all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody said we'd be stealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we pay a little visit to your boss, Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. But let's make a stop first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick emerges from the store with a plastic bag and gets into Kurt's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you need to get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick holds up a box of latex gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more sleeve gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, you should've asked me. I've got a whole box of those in my bedside table. (off their grossed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't judge me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a right up here. Harken's place is about a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive for a beat. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know... this is kinda, I don't know... exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little smile) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're really doing this now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two-story house with a tidy yard. Kurt's car pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and Nick begin pulling on their gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a pair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, last time with the three of us, it got a little... messy. What if Kurt and I go in and you stay here and watch out for Harken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- again, I don't know what he looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone approaches the house, assume it's him and give us a signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll honk the horn six times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe something a little more subtle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honk the horn four times?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you just honk once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People honk once all the time. You'll be running in and out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Honk twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kurt get out of the car. After a beat, Dale remembers his sandwich and pulls it out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and Nick sneak up to the front porch which is camouflaged by shrubs. They peek inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the coast is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt tries the windows. They're locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Guess we'll have to break in the old-fashioned way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt looks around and spots a small rock beside the porch. He picks it up and winds back to throw it at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too late. Kurt has released the rock. It HITS the window, but instead of breaking the glass, the rock itself BREAKS into two pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. I broke the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's one of those hide-a-key things. Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick shows Kurt a key concealed in one half of the fake rock. He grabs it and inserts it into the front door lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys tiptoe in, whispering and tense. The place is tastefully decorated with attractive furniture and modern art. There is a vase of flowers on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. This is not how I pictured his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all we know, he's got a closet full of skin suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAT springs out of nowhere, startling them, then runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's check upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale is finishing the last of his peanut butter sandwich. He checks the rearview mirror. No sign of anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing a la Cher,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Do you believe in love after love/I can feel something inside me say/I really don't think you're strong enough now...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Kurt and Nick enter, the cat suddenly jumps out from behind the door, startling them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it! How many cats do they have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that was the same one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt notices a framed wedding photo on the dresser of Harken and Mrs. Harken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. That's Mrs. Harken? I'd like to cover her in cock yogurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to cover every woman in... did you say `cock yogurt'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet again, Kurt and Nick jump as the cat LEAPS out of hiding with a YOWL then runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's so scared of us, why doesn't he just leave us alone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale plays a bowling game on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon... yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breeze blows through the open windows of the car, catching the plastic bag from Dale's sandwich and carrying it out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Harken, in running attire, comes jogging up the street. His eye is caught by the plastic bag falling from the car window onto the street. He stops and angrily picks up the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, schmuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, surprised, turns to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to tell me why you're littering on my street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry, that blew out the window. I wasn't littering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care if it blew out of your twat. Now, get your fucking Chevy Cavalier the hell off my block!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Sir, there's no need to be hostile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hostile? You want to see hostile? How about I go in the house and get my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Harken begins to choke and his face grows increasingly red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one hand Harken grabs his throat and with the other he looks at the plastic bag he's holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peanuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, yeah. It was a peanut butter sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken collapses to his knees. His face is turning blue now. Dale quickly steps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god! What should I do?! Tell me what to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken yanks up the right leg of his jogging pants revealing an EPI-PEN strapped to his ankle. He reaches for it, but Dale moves faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do with this? Should I inject you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken nods urgently as his eyes begin to roll back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, hold on! I got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale takes the cap off the epi-pen, raises his arm and jams the needle into Harken's chest. Harken lets out a grunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I do it? Did I get enough in?! I'm gonna do it again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale raises his arm again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick continues to search around the bedroom. Kurt is by the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see a Day Runner or an address book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...? Dude, check this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick joins him at the window and they both react as they see what appears to be Dale repeatedly STABBING Harken in the chest, neck and arms. Harken lies motionless on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Harken! Dale's killing Harken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! He's really doing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out where everyone can see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he thinking?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not stopping. He's gonna get us all caught. We've gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Dale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a psychopath. We leave him behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Let's go through the back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they hurry to leave the room, Kurt stumbles over the CAT which has appeared yet again. Unseen by either of them, PELLIT'S BLACKBERRY SLIPS out of his pocket and lands on the floor at the foot of Harken's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Dale kneels over Harken to check his breathing, a car pulls up alongside and MRS. HARKEN steps out. Seeing her husband on the ground, she rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: Oh my god! What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had an allergic reaction. But I think he's coming around. Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: He's my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Harken kneels beside Harken and supports his head.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: Honey? Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken groggily looks down at his torso which is perforated by dozens of tiny needle marks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy, to Dale) Wha-- What did you do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I injected you with your thing.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: He saved your life, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs Dale in a warm hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mrs. Harken) What's this? What's with the hugging?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: I'm just thankful that he was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you are. Do you know this guy?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: No. We just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking him, Rhonda?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: Oh, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing out here, anyway? Waiting to fuck my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never met your wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a bit woozy, Harken gets to his feet and points at Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: Dave, stop it. You should be thanking him. Why are you being so suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because I know you sleep around on me. And I'm going to find out who it is.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: You're being ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? What about Maurilio? I see the way you look at him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HARKEN
dialogues.text: I am not having sex with the gardener!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harken and his wife continue to bicker, Dale quietly retreats to Kurt's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Kurt pace nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that idiot Dale. You realize we're all going to jail because of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go to jail. Look at these eyes. Look at this ass. They'll be all over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean `well'? I'd get raped just as much as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course you would. You're a good-looking guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're more rape-able than I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good. You guys are here. Did you see me out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dale, we saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty neat, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't neat! You stabbed Harken to death in front of the whole neighborhood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not cool, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, that was Harken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd you think you were stabbing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't stabbing anybody. That was an epi-pen. He was having an allergic reaction to peanuts and I injected him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and Nick digest this for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let me understand this. My boss, who we are trying to kill, was dying in front of you and you saved his life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not cool, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, you were just mad at me for killing him and now you're mad at me for not killing him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, this is why I needed to know what these people look like!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a sec. Maybe this recon wasn't a waste of time. Now we know Harken's deathly allergic to peanuts and Pellit has a huge stash of cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could put peanuts in Harken's house and rat poison in Pellit's coke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone would assume that Pellit just got a batch of tainted drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Harken must always have that epi-pen on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They consider this for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet he doesn't wear it in the shower. We could put peanuts in his shampoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect! Two fatal accidents. And we're not even there when they happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That just leaves Julia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night, I'll surveil her and figure out how to take her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'll get some rat poison and take care of Pellit. Dale, think you can get some peanuts into Harken's shampoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. That just leaves us with one final thing to settle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale, if Nick and I were in prison, which one of us would get raped more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Dale's confusion and Nick's annoyance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits in his parked car watching the house through binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through an upstairs window, he sees Pellit enter his bedroom. Nick checks his coat pocket and confirms it contains a Home Depot bag with rat poison inside. Nick dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt sits in his car, reading Maxim magazine. Julia's car pulls up. She gets out, goes to the trunk, opens it, then bends down to get a bag of groceries. Nick watches her ass appreciatively as she does and keeps watching as she heads into her building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: His cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Have you learned anything about Julia yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've learned that Dale is a homosexual because this chick is unbelievably hot. How's it going over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just waiting for Pellit to go to sleep. I wonder how Dale's doing with Harken. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale's car is parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale watches the movie Precious on his laptop. He glances over to see Harken turn on the light in his bedroom. On the seat beside Dale, we see a large jar of Planters peanuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken looks around suspiciously, then goes to Mrs. Harken's closet. He opens it and begins looking through her clothing. He sniffs one of her dresses and his eyes narrow. He sniffs himself, then compares it to the smell of the dress. Unsatisfied, he continues searching around the room for any incriminating evidence. Suddenly, his foot comes in contact with something on the floor. He reaches down and picks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns it on and scrolls down the contacts list to "HOME" which shows Bobby Pellit's name and address. Harken's face turns beet red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale ducks down as he sees Harken's garage door opening. Harken's Porsche 911 pulls out and zooms up the street. Still scooched down, Dale dials his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches Pellit performing a series of sweaty KUNG FU MOVES in a full-length mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, where does he get the energy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Dale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken just left his house. I'm going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale flips on the light and enters clutching the peanut jar in his gloved hands. He slides open the shower curtain and Harken's CAT LEAPS OUT at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He regains his composure and finds a bottle of men's shampoo. As he nervously removes the cap from the shampoo and the lid from the peanuts, he notices that MR. PEANUT is STARING right at him. Despite his jaunty top hat and little monocle, there is something almost accusing in his look. Dale stares back at Mr. Peanut as we see his resolve soften.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick watches as Pellit finally gets into bed and turns off his bedside lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick reaches for the door handle as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: Nick's cell phone rings. Nick jumps, then answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure if I can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Harken's bathroom. About to pour the nuts in his shampoo. But, I just... I know he's a real shithead, but he's still a person, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights appear in Nick's rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at the rat poison,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken's Porsche pulls up and stops just behind Nick's car. Harken gets out and heads toward Pellit's front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I do? Should I do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Nick looks up to see HARKEN knocking on Pellit's door. In the bedroom, Pellit's light goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Harken. He's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Pellit's?! Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He's knocking on his door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would Harken even know Pellit? 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking irritated, Pellit answers the door. Before he can get a word out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Harken removes a gun from his pocket and SHOOTS Pellit twice in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick reacts, slumping down in his seat, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god oh my god oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What? What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shot him. Harken shot Pellit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Is he dead?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With shaking hands, Nick reaches for his ignition but knocks the car keys out. They fall onto the floor of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick bends down to find his keys, Harken's shadow looms over him. Nick cowers just out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken looks around. Did he hear something? No. He calmly but briskly walks away from Nick's car, gets into his own and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harken's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Pellit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not moving. He looks dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! What do we do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get out of here before someone sees me! Meet me at the bar. I'll call Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick ZOOMS away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's car SPEEDS through a red light at an intersection. A TRAFFIC CAMERA FLASHES as it snaps Nick's photo and license plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With trembling hands, Nick and Dale take deep gulps of their drinks. Kurt hurries in, looking disheveled. The ensuing conversation is conducted in tense whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's all stay calm and figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm? How can we be calm? I watched a man die an hour ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man you were going to kill anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I had it in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you guys! You can't just bail on a plan like that at the last minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think when it came down to it, you would've been able to murder Julia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I mean, afterwards, it was kind of hard to imagine killing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick and Dale turn to him, quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Afterwards'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt realizes what he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slept with her, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god. Please tell me you didn't sleep with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know. But it's not my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt's car is parked across the street.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At first I was surveilling her just like I was supposed to... 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt watches through her bedroom window as Julia undresses sexily.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then she started deliberately undressing in front of the window. With the lights on. She must've known I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julia removes her bra, we see Kurt's face pressed against his car window, his breath fogging it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia enters her bedroom with a tray of food. She wears a skimpy kimono-style robe. She sits on her bed and unwraps a Popsicle.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then she made herself a little snack. A Popsicle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Julia eat the Popsicle as suggestively as humanly possible. Then she picks up a banana and peels it.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... then a banana....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia eases the whole banana into her mouth. Then she picks up a hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... and finally a hot dog. I mean, three penis-shaped foods cannot be coincidence. And in that weird order? That's not a proper meal.

dialogues.speaker: DALE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So you took that as an invitation to fuck her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia opens her front door, stares straight at Kurt and beckons him inside with one finger. She walks back inside, leaving the door wide open.

dialogues.speaker: KURT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No. I took her invitation to fuck her as an invitation to fuck her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt opens his car door so quickly he tumbles out headfirst, planting his face on the street. He jumps up, but one ankle is tangled in the seatbelt. He finally extricates himself and hurries to the house as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something clinically wrong with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm a rapscallion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a rapscallion. You're a whore. A filthy whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Not nice. And besides, I think I actually solved your problem, Dale. Julia just needed a good fucking. I bet she's not going to mess with you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. We have bigger fish to fry right now. What do we do about Harken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what we do. We call the cops and make an anonymous tip that Harken killed Pellit. Boom. Harken's in jail. Pellit's in hell. Julia's had the crazy fucked out of her. Our problems are solved. Boom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but we should find a payphone. We don't want them tracing the call to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Kurt and Dale emerge from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we'll take my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them climb into Nick's car. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Nick can even pull out of his parking spot, they hear the WHOOP of a police siren and see the flashing lights of a SQUAD CAR behind them. The guys' faces go white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick unrolls his window as one COP approaches his side and his PARTNER comes up on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the owner of this vehicle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes. Is there something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got an APB on a black Kia Spectra, license 4HIG208.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A traffic cam caught this vehicle fleeing the scene of a crime tonight. I'm going to need you to follow us to the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer? This is not my car. Is it okay if I just -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three of you, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick glares at Kurt as the cops head back to their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt, Nick and Dale sit in a waiting area looking equal parts terrified and pissed at each other. Throughout the following, they speak in hushed voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know everything. We're dead. I can't believe I let you guys talk me into this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. We were just being hypothetical. You're the one who pushed us to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't even say anything about Harken now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well, Kurt, being outside the murder victim's house because I was planning to murder him probably isn't the best alibi in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I didn't actually do anything illegal, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke into two people's houses and stole a BlackBerry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna rat on me, Dale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, since I'm the only one without a connection to the murder, yeah, maybe I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means you'd also rat on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I rat on Dale first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a burly detective, HAGAN, appears behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this way, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys glare angrily at each other as they follow Hagan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Dale and Kurt sit on metal chairs across a table from Hagan and his equally burly partner, SAMSON. Hagan slides a PHOTO across the table to Nick. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: taken by the traffic camera. His terrified face is clear, as is the time stamp at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to explain why you were driving 61 in a 25 zone, a block from the victim's house two minutes after he was shot to death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... was drag racing. (off their skeptical

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a drag racer. There's no law against that, is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were drag racing in a Kia Spectra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't win a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what I don't understand. You're at the crime scene. An hour later when we find your car, you just happen to be hanging out with this guy... (gestures to Dale) ... a registered sex offender --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tsk tsk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and this guy... (gestures at Kurt and holds up a wallet) ... whose employee ID says he works for Pellit Chemicals, the victim's company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. My boss was murdered?! Bobby Pellit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to get you a Kleenex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing near his house?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick looks at him, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you during the murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was making love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Making love.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cops) Let me ask you something, Detective. Let's say one of us knew who the shooter was and was willing to hand you that perp on a platter. Would he be entitled to some sort of immunity for that information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Dale and Nick shoot daggers at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But he would be entitled to some sort of jail time. Because if he knew who the shooter was and didn't tell us, that would be obstruction of justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I'm glad we have no idea who the shooter is, right, guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you expect us to believe this is all just a big coincidence, we're going to be here for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's Kurt and Nick who look nervous. Is Dale about to crack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saying that we'll be here for a long time implies that we can't leave. Does that mean we're under arrest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samson looks to Hagan who grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We just brought you in for questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you don't have evidence constituting probable cause to arrest us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, we're free to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale nervously stands up, half expecting to be hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt and Nick, impressed and relieved, stand and head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three guys head for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work. Where'd that come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Law & Order.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really showed those guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `We'? You were gonna turn us in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For, like, a second.

dialogues.speaker: SAMSON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys turn to see Samson holding out a traffic citation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing it to Nick) For speeding and running a red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get too comfortable out there, boys. Our forensics team is sweeping Pellit's house for fingerprints and DNA. And they don't miss much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HOLD ON Kurt's face and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt pulls Pellit's toothbrush out of his butt and returns it to its holder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt suddenly looks nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt drives, Nick is in front and Dale in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are so fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time to lawyer up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have money for a lawyer. I gave all my money to Cocksucker Jones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's right! I forgot all about Cocksucker. Why don't we ask him what to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did pay him five thousand dollars to be our murder consultant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it was five thousand forty with the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF their looks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker Jones looks up from his bar stool, surprised to see Nick, Kurt and Dale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh damn, look who's back. How did it go with the Strangers on a Train shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not great. We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of our intended victims killed another of our intended victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up! What kind of evil geniuses are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't even know why it happened. But the cops brought us in as suspects. What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first. I'm gonna need another five thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No way. You said the last five thousand would cover this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine. Pay for my drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nick puts down a few bills on the bar, Dale leans in to Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the best negotiator, is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you this -- the guy who killed the other guy you were planning on killing, are the police after him too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They don't suspect him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, so you're gonna need to encourage him to turn himself in, by say, kidnapping his wife and mailing him her earlobe or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, the earlobe's vestigial. (off their looks) All right, how about you trick him into confessing what he did while you wear a wire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wire. That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how the cops caught you when you murdered someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about? I never murdered anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you I killed somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did. You said you served a `dime' for `some pretty ugly shit.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever see the movie Snow Falling on Cedars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got caught with a video camera making a bootleg copy of that movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did ten years for video piracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's a federal offense. They take that shit serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also made the mistake of representing myself at trial. May have insulted a few of the jurors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. You're telling me we've been taking murder advice from someone whose biggest crime was taping an Ethan Hawke movie?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you do know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not a murderer, why do you carry that gun on your belt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls back his jacket to reveal the holster we saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a motherfucking iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the phone out and shows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like such a moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you are a moron. You don't walk into a bar and hand a guy five thousand dollars just because he's black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, guys. Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them turn to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after them) Trust me on the wire thing, though. Worked for Donnie Brasco. Bootlegged that movie too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagan and Samson pull up in their car and get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detectives enter to find a CRIME TECH leaning over his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got something for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't find any foreign prints in the house, but we did get a DNA match for one of your suspects, Kurt Gamble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pellit's upstairs bathroom. His toothbrush. It had traces of Gamble's fecal matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sick bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not all. We found feces on Pellit's hairbrush, face soap, floss and razor.
