dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Razor?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The handle. Not the blade. This Gamble guy put just about everything in that bathroom up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I care about is that it puts him inside the house. That's enough for a warrant for him and his drag racing, sex offender friends. (takes out cell) I'll call the DA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt's car pulls up with the lights off and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt is at the wheel, Nick sits shotgun, Dale in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, looks quiet. Is the tape recorder ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dale pulls out a mini-tape recorder and hands it to Nick along with a roll of surgical tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresh batteries, fresh six-hour tape, voice activated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us needs to tape it to our chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it. I'm the only one without hair on my chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's `cause you shave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't shave it. I wax it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick gives Kurt the recorder and Kurt tapes it to his chest then lowers his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do now? Wait for Harken to come home and ambush him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a better idea. Let's be in the house when he walks in. He'll be so mad, he'll be more likely to confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. We'll sit there in the dark till he comes in, and then switch on a lamp. That'll freak him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we should find an office chair so one of us can dramatically spin around and face Harken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you get to be the guy in the chair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could try and find more than one office chair so the three of us can spin around at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't sound intimidating. That sounds like a musical number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're right. I'll turn on the lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm just supposed to stand there like an idiot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're recording it all. You're the most important member of the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't patronize me, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenny scampers out, pulling up his pants as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is in his new office as a young employee, CARTER, 20's, pops his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me, Mr. Waters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Carter. Just wanted to check if you had a chance to finish those regional sales projections yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I think I may need another day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I was hoping to give them to the marketing guys today, but I can hold them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the future, it'd be great if you could tell me if you're going to miss a deadline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter's eyes narrow. All at once, he rushes at Nick, grabs him by the throat and HURLS him THROUGH THE PLATE GLASS WINDOW, shattering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick plummets forty feet and lands with a SICKENING CRUNCH directly onto his own car. Just behind him we see a parking plaque that reads "Nick Waters, Senior VP of Sales."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter stands opposite Nick as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. No problem, Mr. Waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick smiles and closes the door behind Carter. He settles into his comfy chair and puts his feet up on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to be the boss.
